info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 3:16PM CDT until July 16 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Wisconsin, including the following county, Waushara.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wautoma, Redgranite, Plainfield, Napowan Scout Camp, Silver Lake, Pine River, Dakota, Mount Morris, Saxeville, Wild Rose, Richford, Spring Lake, Coloma, Hancock, Lohrville, Poy Sippi, Auroraville, West Bloomfield, Borth and Tustin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING
